title: UI/UX Designer
description:
About Us

Encord is a London-based startup building a comprehensive training data solution for computer vision AI applications. We are backed by CRV, Y Combinator Continuity, the Harvard Management Company, top industry executives, and other leading Bay Area investors.

Started by ex-computer scientists, physicists, and quants, we felt firsthand how the lack of tools to prepare quality training data was impeding the progress of building practical AI. AI feels to us like what the early days of computing or the internet must have felt like, where the potential of the technology is clear, but the tools and processes surrounding it are terrible. We have devised a unique methodology for automating the tasks related to preparing quality training data, in effect turning the training data problem into a data science problem.

The Role

We are looking for an experienced UI/UX design engineer to help us build, design, and ship delightful and innovative products and features for modelling... creating, and managing training data for building AI applications. You will be collaborating closely with our customers to understand how they interact with our web-based UI’s, and how we can make them more intuitive and look prettier.

Our ideal UI/UX designer has taken part in designing technical B2B/Enterprise SaaS products from ideating using wireframes and all the way to production. Needless to say, the right candidate is passionate about beautiful product UX and design.

Qualifications

The right candidate will have proven experience working with web frontend development and design, with any of the following is a plus:

• Rapid prototyping of user interfaces using commonly used tools such as Figma, Photoshop, or similar

• A good understanding of the formal elements of design, not just limited to the web and including typography, layout, balance, and proportion

• Experience building public facing websites that work elegantly across commonly used browsers

• Advanced knowledge of modern HTML and CSS

What We Offer

Encord offers a unique opportunity to be part of a startup with a clear mission and vision. You will get to explore and build services enterprise AI use cases across many different industry verticals such as healthcare, surveillance, retail, and agriculture.

Our work is at the cutting edge of computer vision and deep learning, which also includes working on solving unsolved problems within those fields. We offer competitive compensation and equity options in the business for the right candidate

title: UI/UX Designer - DApps
description:
UX/UI Designer - Blockchain - Dapps

Location: London, Soho

Industry: Blockchain | Tech

Salary Range: Industry leading base, crypto LTIP (Tezos tokens) and great benefits

About:

TriliTech is a Tezos blockchain research and development hub based in London, UK. We are on a mission to advance the state of the art in blockchain technology, building the most scalable, secure and energy-efficient decentralised platform in the world.

Tezos is an open-source platform for assets and applications that can evolve by upgrading itself. We are one of the original proof of stake smart contract layer one blockchains. Since launching in 2018, Tezos has been utilised for hundreds of projects, attracted a vibrant, global community, and logged millions of transactions. Our proof of stake design means it can operate in an energy efficient manner, consuming over two-million times less energy than popular proof of work networks.

Our current corporate partners include Redbull Racing, McLaren, Ubisoft... Societe Generale and many others. Projects built on the Tezos blockchain include Hic Et Nunc, , Interpop, OneOf and Kukai.

The Role:

Here at Trilitech, we are moving through rapid growth and are currently offering a fantastic opportunity for a UX/UI designer to come and join our small and expanding team.

You will be responsible for designing applications on the Tezos blockchain and digital tools - including websites and design resources - that foster ecosystem growth. To this end, you will contribute to design-related efforts surrounding product development and community outreach, including user research, prototyping, testing and iterating on attractive consistent UX.

Day to Day you will:

Work with cross-functional teams to define scope and features of product

Support the development team with the implementation of prepared design concept

Develop design concepts for web and mobile applications and interfaces driven by personas, user-stories and user experience

Develop user scripts, design layouts, development of user-first interfaces

Essential Requirements:

Based in London or Berlin

A creative, current portfolio that shows potential for experimentation

Demonstrable UX skills: experience translating project specs to user flows, wireframes and final designs

Visual design skills: the ability to present clear information architecture and craft inspiring visual designs

Design systems experience: comfort working within and maintaining design systems

User Research experience: Familiarity with different methods and use cases

Accessibility and ethics familiarity: familiarity with principles and experience integrating into designs

Genuine interest in Blockchain

Nice to have:

Experience designing for open source projects

Familiarity with front end programming languages

Benefits:

You will have the opportunity to:

Become an expert in blockchain technologies

Spend 20% of your time working on blockchain-related passion projects

You will also receive:

Highly competitive compensation package

Generous pension scheme and core benefits

Tez (Tezos tokens) LTIP scheme

Flexible hybrid working policy

25 days holiday plus a day off for your birthday

Culture:

We care deeply about our culture and have developed it across five key pillars:

Autonomy: we believe in hiring great people, then giving them the space and flexibility to work in the way that's best for them. We will agree on goals, and then expect you to decide how you want to pursue those goals.

Collaboration: as a fast growing small business we all work together across multiple workstreams. We have a flat structure and encourage frank discussion, honesty and openness.

Learning and development: the blockchain space is developing at an incredibly fast rate. Having a growth mentality and being open to continuous learning is an important part of our culture. It's always OK to not know the answer to something and have to do some research! We cement this by offering more formal perks to help fund employees' continued education.

Diversity and Inclusion: inclusiveness is one of our blockchain's core strengths, and in the same way we are committed to inclusiveness across all diversity dimensions. We are also actively looking for talent outside of the immediate blockchain space. What we primarily look for is general markers of excellence and ambition.

Mission driven: we believe that the Tezos blockchain is going to change the world and our goal is to promote its adoption. Blockchain technology will power new positive change, increase the democratisation of previously restricted systems and create transparency and trust

title: Mid-Level UI/UX Designer
description:
Sports Interactive (SI) is an ambitious development studio creating immersive sports management simulations. Since 1994, we’ve captivated a global audience of players with our iconic, BAFTA award-winning game, Football Manager. We’re a wholly-owned subsidiary of SEGA, having caught their attention in 2006 with our continuous critical and commercial success.

We’re a tenacious community, coming together at the Here East technology hub in Stratford, East London. Always expanding, the SI team takes on the gaming genre through a diverse array of disciplines. No matter how big we dream, though, we keep our approach (and your schedule) flexible, creating a relaxed atmosphere where collaboration can thrive.

Position Overview:

We are seeking a talented UI/UX Designer for our fast-growing Design team. Collaborating with the UI and Games Design teams you will be assisting in improvements being made to the overall UI of the product, with a specific focus on usability. This role offers the... chance to work on and develop for the world’s leading football management simulation titles. We are also aiming to improve our accessibility support to ensure our games are enjoyed by a wider range of audiences and would hope the successful applicant shares that passion.

The successful candidate will be organised, self-motivated and able to communicate with all disciplines, both within the design team and across the wider studio. You'll be keen to share your expertise and experience as well as committed to the constant improvement of your own skills and knowledge.

Please note: Due to the high volume of applications we receive any applications without a portfolio link showcasing your best work will be discounted.

Key Responsibilities:
• Collaborate with Games Design in developing new and exciting features for upcoming versions of Football Manager.
• Produce UI designs & assets of a consistently high quality.
• Communicate your work through Site Maps, User flows and early stage wireframing through to hi-res mock-ups.
• Work with the UI/UX Design Lead and Production to develop and grow your skillset.
• Within cross-disciplinary Feature Pods, collaborate with QA, Production, and other development disciplines to ensure all new features are placing the user and usability as a top priority.

Knowledge, Skill and Experience:
• Strong understanding of key UI design principles
• Ability to produce high quality, visually appealing UI assets
• Ability to communicate clearly and tell stories throughout the design process
• Experience with visual design software such as Figma and Miro
• A passion for UIUX design
• A yearning to understand and meet the needs of the user
• Ability to work collaboratively and as part of a close-knit team
• Clear written and verbal communication.

Desirable:
• Experience creating prototypes, wireframes and developing user flows
• 2+ years UI/UX professional experience within software production (ideally within the games industry but not exclusively)
• Experience in Unity
• Animation or motion design skills (e.g. After Effects, Principle etc.)
• Basic knowledge of HTML/CSS or similar
• Basic Understanding of Accessibility settings in games
• Experience of Adobe Suite (Illustrator/Photoshop)
• Interest in Football Manager and Football, whilst very helpful, is not essential

Working Here:

We approach everything with passion, whether that’s leaving our mark on the gaming and football industries or doing our bit for the world around us. We want to share that outlook with everyone who works here.

We like our talent to be tenacious, so you can expect to surround yourself with other ambitious individuals bringing their A-game to many different disciplines. We know collaboration is the key to consistent improvement and encourage our people to truly realise their own personal potential.

We believe everyone matters, no matter which part of the business you’re in. Above all else, we’re a team. A team with a down-to-earth dynamic that works and plays together. We have fun doing what we do and that’s one of the many reasons we’re one of the best places to work in the UK games business (Gameindustry 2021 Large studio category).

If you want a positive work/life balance, we’re right behind you. While we live to create extraordinary games, we know that’s not all you’ve got going on, so you can trust that we always keep things in perspective, fostering an environment where work can be more than just a job.

Our flexible working culture gives team members the responsibility to optimise their workloads, with in-office, hybrid, and remote working options. Even in countries where we don’t directly employ*, we’ll explore what’s possible via third parties and do our best to accommodate location preferences.

When you’re not here making the world’s best management games, there’s a top-class benefits package for permanent team members based in the UK including gym membership, private health, and dental care, plus many more perks. For permanent team members outside of the UK, we strive to offer equivalent and localised benefits. We’re also a London Living Wage employer and proudly boast one of the lowest staff turnover rates in the industry.
• We’re able to directly employ in the UK, Ireland, France, Sweden and Finland.

Inclusivity Matters:
We’re proud to be an equal opportunities employer and encourage applications from any relevant candidate irrespective of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, religion, or belief. Our studio has disabled access and facilities.

SI is proudly a Disability Confident Committed employer, and we are dedicated to ensuring our recruitment process is inclusive and accessible. Our studio has disabled access and facilities but please ensure you advise us if you require any other reasonable adjustments to be made to support you during the recruitment process.

We have evolved as a product organisation over the last five years, with UX and UI design being done locally within product teams. We're now at a scale where we are ready for greater leadership across our design approach, to build a more coherent customer experience. We're looking for someone to take on this leadership role and step up the maturity of our UX/UI design model.

In this newly created role, as our Lead UX/UI Designer you'll relish the opportunity to write the rulebook on how we design at IAGL – specifically building our design system from the ground up. You'll enjoy the challenge of designing across four established airline brands, whilst bringing to life a unifying identity for loyalty that is relevant, inspiring and rewarding. You'll have the vision and influence to lead across multiple product teams in a... matrix organisation to achieve our design goals, working confidently with both contract and permanent design colleagues.

You'll enjoy the challenge of shaping this new role and playing a leadership role in the next phase of our growth. You'll have the opportunity to work across our wide-ranging product set, covering leading-edge technologies and touching partners in the airline, travel, finance and retail sectors.

How will I add value in this role?

You'll get under the skin of our user experience design today, identifying the assets, tools and ways of working in play, and how they ultimately come together to create our user experience. You'll set a strategy for world-class UX/UI design and provide the leadership to get us there.

You'll create IAG Loyalty's visual language by building a design system for use across cross-functional product teams, developing and designing products for our partner airlines (British Airways, Iberia, Aer Lingus and Vueling). You'll drive adoption of the design system across our design and product community, working with teams to ensure a clear set of design standards are being met whilst actively utilising the input of our teams to continuously improve the system.

You'll always see the bigger picture and help build a holistic view of all the customer touchpoints, setting a strong foundation to build coherent and delightful customer experiences on. You'll also bring a fresh pair of eyes to the role, spotting opportunities to improve the way UX design is done at IAG Loyalty.

You'll act as a leader, coaching and supporting designers with design system adoption and ways of working. You'll implement best practices to bring our design community across IAGL together, as well as translating your design vision for audiences across the organisation.

You'll enjoy the visibility you'll have at all levels of our organisation, providing a ‘consulting' style approach to the way to you influence, shape and challenge our thinking.

What experience would you like me to have?

You'll be a senior UX/UI designer with experience across web and app channels, and with a range of design tools including Figma.

You'll have a strong track record in developing design systems that power brilliant and inclusive customer experiences. You'll be well versed in the design landscape with an understanding of how the best organisations are approaching design today.

You'll have the ability to embed yourself across the Product organisation and become the go-to for UX/UI leadership. Your communication skills will extend to both design and non-design audiences, to ensure the importance and strategy for design is understood by all. Your ability to manage stakeholders will be key to your success. You're able to influence without having direct control.

You'll have experience setting and leading UX/UI strategy and have the desire to go beyond the ‘doing' and into a functional leadership role.

title: Senior UI Designer
description:
Who we are:

For over 20 years, Global Relay has set the standard in enterprise information archiving with industry-leading cloud archiving, surveillance, eDiscovery, and analytics solutions. We securely capture and preserve the communications data of the world’s most highly regulated firms, giving them greater visibility and control over their information and ensuring compliance with stringent regulations.

Though we offer competitive compensation and benefits and all the other perks one would expect from an established company, we are not your typical technology company. Global Relay is a career-building company. A place for big ideas. New challenges. Groundbreaking innovation. It’s a place where you can genuinely make an impact – and be recognized for it.

We believe great businesses thrive on diversity, inclusion, and the contributions of all employees. To that end, we recruit candidates from different backgrounds and foster a work environment that encourages employees to... collaborate and learn from each other, completely free of barriers.

We encourage you to apply if your qualifications and experience are a good fit for any of our openings.

Your Role:

Global Relay's enterprise applications have a substantial footprint in the messaging & archiving space for compliance. This role provides an excellent opportunity to help solve challenging problems and create incredible experiences that significantly impact high-profile customers.

The UI Designer focuses on visually guiding the user through a product’s interface via interactive elements across multiple platforms (web, desktop and mobile). This will involve creating high-fidelity mock-ups, iconography, UI illustration and other graphic assets for a range of products and services. The UI Designer will be responsible for taking Global Relay's Design System to the next level by delivering pixel-perfect designs that bring clarity and unity to our visual language.

Working with other UI and UX Designers, Product Managers and Engineering teams in a highly customer-focused agile environment, you will be involved in the product development lifecycle from concept to delivery to help define our products' vision.

Your Job:
• Design and evolve the look and feel of Global Relay's visual language
• Follow a Human Centred Design approach and adhere to UX best practices
• Apply with conviction the best principles of layout composition, typography, visual hierarchy and motion design
• Deliver pixel-perfect graphic assets that are aesthetically vibrant
• Lead and create user interfaces that are sleek and easy to use
• Translate high-level requirements and interaction flows into intuitive and functional user interfaces
• Communicate your design ideas with conviction within the UX team and non-creative stakeholders
• Develop storyboards, wireframes, mock-ups, and prototypes to communicate design ideas and solutions effectively
• Design and document new components and interaction patterns for Global Relay's Design System
• Ensure new components and designs meet WCAG and WAI-ARIA accessibility standards
• Adhere to existing patterns and apply consistency accordingly
• Identify opportunities for UI improvement or differentiation
• Facilitate workshops to get cross-team alignment on new standards
• Support engineers focused on building the design system
• Measure and monitor the performance of the components you work on
• Champion and establish a solid UI practice and be accountable for the UI output
• Work alongside engineering teams to test and iterate on the interface design
• Guide engineering teams through the build and QA process
• Collaborate closely with other UI and UX Designers to find practical solutions to challenging workflows
• Coach and support junior UI designers in the team

About You:

We’re looking for a UI designer with true artistic talent and a clean, strong visual aesthetic. Relevant training and work experience are important, but we’re really looking for your talent to shine through in the work you have done.
• 5+ years of experience doing visual/UI design for web, desktop and mobile applications
• Portfolio of relevant UI design work from shipped products/ apps/ services
• Bachelor's degree in a design-related discipline is preferable
• Solid understanding of user-centered design best practices
• Strong typographic and colour theory knowledge
• Ability to create icons, illustrations and other graphic assets for the web
• Ability to create and quickly iterate on high-fidelity mock-ups
• Ability to create high-fidelity prototypes to communicate motion and screen transition
• Ability to communicate UI ideas verbally and visually in an efficient and clear manner
• Ability to take ownership and solve problems creatively
• Experience working with and contributing to design systems and component libraries
• Knowledge of responsive design and mobile design guidelines
• Knowledge of accessibility best practices and approaches
• Knowledge of conventional design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, Sketch etc.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills
• Ability to multi-task and keep organized in a dynamic environment
• Motion design experience is an asset
• Experience in an enterprise business environment and Agile is definitely an asset

What you can expect:

At Global Relay, there’s no ceiling to what you can achieve. It’s the land of opportunity for the energetic, the intelligent, the driven. You’ll receive the mentoring, coaching, and support you need to reach your career goals. You’ll be part of a culture that breeds creativity and rewards perseverance and hard work. And you’ll be working alongside smart, talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, with complementary knowledge and skills.

Global Relay is an equal-opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion.

We seek to ensure reasonable adjustments, accommodations, and personal time are personalized to meet the unique needs of every individual.

We understand flexible work arrangements are important, and we encourage that in our work culture. Whether it’s flexibility around work hours, workstyle, or lifestyle, we want to ensure our employees have a healthy work/life balance. We support and value a hybrid work model that blends collaboration with the team in the office and focus time from the comfort of your home.

To learn more about our business, culture, and community involvement, visit www.globalrelay.com
